puzzle.help: 1. The view of the board is a castle with every tile identifying a Room. Between Rooms there are doors that can be open or closed. At the start of the game all doors are open. 2. Each number inside a Room tells you how many other Rooms you see from there, in a straight line horizontally or vertically when the appropriate doors are closed. 3. At the end of the solution, each Room must be reachable from the others. That means no single Room or group of Rooms can be divided by the others. 4. In harder levels some tiles won't tell you how many Rooms are visible at all.
